p: The guidelines suggest that saturated fat consumption be restricted to 10% of total calories. However, there is no scientific evidence that supports the real benefits of such a limit for the reduction of cardiovascular disease onset; it is still controversial [ 33]. A meta-analysis that focused on the relationship between saturated fats and cardiovascular risk did not identify any significant link [ 34]. It must be considered that cardiovascular disease development is multifactorial; therefore, it is difficult to understand the real role played by palm oil alone. Further studies on this potential risk are needed before drawing any conclusion.
